Seeking feedback/advise on car paint protection coating.Currently I have the TitaniumSH coating applied. In future  if I want to use other type of ceramic coating  do I need to get the new vendor to remove the old coating first? Or new ceramic coating can be applied over the old coating?
see how long ur coating suppose to last
esp if u park under the sun
I understand coating doesn't last forever. My question was if need to remove the old coat first or just inform the guy about it and let them settle it before they apply new (different) ceramic coat.
It's gone when the next shop does polishing
Hi 👋My car having issues with ants 🐜Any suggestions to eliminate them ?
Tsk next time don’t eat in car
From top to bottom clear everything

The implied meaning is.. after its gone its gone.. cus before coating they will polish one time. So whatever coating u have.. also gone w the coating.. but just make a mental note of when ur coating supposedly suppose to end
I put ant gel for awhile
You'll need to visit a shop that specialise in removing such pests (ants/cockroaches). They will usually smoke them out then do a full internal cleaning.
Thanks for feedback. It's hard to gauge when the existing will be worn off. Guess I'll just inform the shop before they do their coating work. Thanks
U put water see does it stay
And whether ur door handles got crying marks
I use water to dry it
Er ur door handles there usually if it rains or whatever..
Before coating alot. After coating dont have. When coating wearing off  it’ll come back
Sometimes got the stain near door handles or behind or wherever lah
something worser than this but yes this
No I don't. I just have lots of small light scratches
then ur coating shud be fine?
Something like this. Once every 6 months I have to bring car back to shop for them to polish it. Thankfully it's free.
u ownself wash car or use automated wash ah
I have no idea how those 'scratch' marks come about as I don't even those outside of those areas. It's on all 4 door handles and I don't ferry ppl around  so I only touch driver side door handle.
I can understand if it's only at driver side handle to have scratches.

I remember reading somewhere before that because of that curved recessed portion for the handles  wind “cuts” in and sometimes with very fine debris  it will scratch the surface of the car. I don’t know how true it is though
got fine particles in the air
i mean if pebbles hit u  u will know
but sometimes very fine dust or whatever u cant see it nor feel it
but that's my take on the scratches
But for these micro scratches  I used to use toothpaste and it magically removes it. Currently using Soft99 and also gets rid of all these fine scratches
Toothpaste any toothpaste also can HAHA.
I bought it at Esso last year
I haven’t used it on the entire car cause I lazy but I’ve been using it for spot touch ups on these fine scratches and light stains and it works really great

It's just strange that it's at the car door handle area and not around the whole car. Can it be so specific that the 'wind cut' velocity is so great around the door handles and not at other areas of the car? hmmm

I assume the main body of the car is designed aerodynamically so wind glides through it but for door handles  it protrudes out so it will “cut” the wind. And the recessed area probably creates a small whirlpool effect? I don’t know the physics behind how wind travels so that’s just my assumption on how I believe causes these scratches hahaha
I'm driving a Honda Fit GR (2020). It's not exactly that aerodynamic. lol

It’s a very common problem but an easy fix so I don’t think too much about it. You can try toothpaste for a more DIY approach! It seems to work just fine but I don’t know if it may affect the paint condition in the long run so I ended up using a proper car wax to remove them.
Next time I'll use microfiber cloth and toothpaste to try remove the micro scratches.
Watson got sell the soft99 ah
Recently my car got alot dirt stains cannot wash

pretty sure it's nails from ppl who use the door  and if we carry bags on our body it brush against it. that's why fine scratches at the door handle area.even if you seldom open the door  you still use it once in a while.if it's caused by debris and fine particles  pretty sure front bumper would have gotten it badly instead of door handle.
That's the issue  too many scratches to be from ppl cos I don't ferry ppl that often to accumulate so much. Anyway  I'll just try the toothpaste 'fix' to see if it'll work the next round.
could have gotten those scratches from car wash too
it builds up over time.i seldom fetch ppl too. but i open it to put stuffs at backseat.starting to see scratches on mine too after 3yrs.

The car wash workers  I'm familiar with them  they don't have pouches. But the possibility of their nails scratching it when opening and closing is a possibility. Just that I wash at most once a fortnight if it's really dirty.

I see. It looks like battle scars from automated car wash to me. Check your c pillar as well. Those are common areas but you’ll probably need to shine light at it or view it from certain angles.

I understand. So far I let it accumulate and I just return to the shop to have it polished (for free) while paying for a simple car wash (for their services). That's why I'm thinking of changing to a different type of coating next year when the time is right.

Honda paint is generally thinner so it is prone to scratches.

I'm using TitaniumSH coating. So the scratch should be on the coating or deep enough to go past the coating. Well  this was in my earlier post on the coating question. It's ok. I'll observe if it still appears when I use a different car protection coat next year.
Not sure how to answer. Original + patch (top up after 2 yrs) application?
